dict.string: ### Requires Keyboard Maestro 8.0.3+ ### set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE" tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" set kmSoundOutputName to getvariable "local_SoundOutputName" instance kmInst end tell -- Localization (English) set locWindowSound to "Sound" set locButtonOutput to "Output" -- Localization (Nederlands) -- set locWindowSound to "Geluid" -- set locButtonOutput to "Uitvoer" -- Localization (Deutsch) -- set locWindowSound to "Ton" -- set locButtonOutput to "Ausgabe" tell application "System Preferences" reveal pane id "com.apple.preference.sound" end tell tell application "System Events" tell application process "System Preferences" repeat until exists tab group 1 of window locWindowSound end repeat delay 0.1 tell tab group 1 of window locWindowSound repeat until exists radio button locButtonOutput end repeat delay 0.1 click radio button locButtonOutput tell table 1 of scroll area 1 select (row 1 where value of text field 1 is kmSoundOutputName) end tell end tell end tell end tell

dict.string:
ERROR: Unable to set the Sound Output to: %Variable%local_SoundOutputName%
Possible Causes:
- The macro variable local_SoundOutputName may be incorrectly set; it is case sensitive and punctuation marks must exactly match. For example, Jim’s Airpods Pro includes a smart apostrophe ( ’ ).
- The AppleScript localization locWindowSound and locButtonOutput may be improperly set.

dict.string: tell application "System Preferences" quit end tell
Set Sound Output: Elgato Wave XLR
